712969f.text:
42nd Street, west from Park Avenue. The new east side Interborough Subway is under construction under what will later be named Pershing
Square.
Summer, 1916.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

712972f-b.text:
42nd Street, south side, from Park to Madison Avenues, showing the Hotel Belmont and the two buildings about to be demolished: the Lincoln Safe Deposit Company and the Athens Hotel.
May 15, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
May 15, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712967f.text:
E. 42nd Street, at the S. W. corner of Pershing Sduare (Park Avenue), showing the future air terminal site. This location has been vacant for years and formerly occupied by the Belmont Hotel. The photographer is viewing southeastward and shows in the left background, the Pershing Square Building
(41st to 42nd Streets).
November 1, 1939
Gift of George Jiranek
New York Public Library
Photostat Division
Neg #2243

712968f-a.text:
E. 42nd Street, at the S. W. corner of Pershing Square (Park Avenue), showing the new air terminal site. To the left background is the Pershing Square Building. Note also the Park Avenue vehicular viaduct. At the right is E. 41st Street.
November 1, 1939
Gift of George Jiranek
New York Public Library
Photostat Division
Neg # 721
